page.title: 18CLUBS AND SOCIETIES IN CLYRO
page.content: {YOUNG FARMERS CLUB The club is open to anyone between the ages of ten and twenty six. Meetings take place on Monday evenings at the Primary school. There are many inter club competitions during the year. Competitions include; public speaking, stock judging, craft, cookery, flower arranging and sports. Social activities include exchange visits with other clubs, annual dinner and dances. There are forty members. {WOMEN'S INSTITUTE} Part of a national organisation and co-ordinated locally by the Powys/ Radnor Federation. The twenty five members meet on the fourth Tuesday of every month at the Church Hall. Winter study courses and summer outings are organised. Support is given to County events such as Displays, Surveys, Eisteddfodau and annual Hospital teas.
